en: When the fire broke out, he was sound asleep.
zh: 起火的时候，他睡得正香。

en: What caused the fire?
There's no smoke without fire.
Don't go near the fire.
The fire started immediately.
There is no rose without thorns.
In Kabuki, not only talent, but also heredity counts.
zh: 在歌舞伎中，不仅看天赋，还得看出身。

en: He hates singing in public because his songs are kind of bad.
zh: 他讨厌当众唱歌，因为他唱得挺难听的。

en: If only I could sing well.
zh: 要是我能唱得好就好了。

en: There's a lot of fruit.
Fruit tends to rot right away.
Read this book when you have time.
Technology progresses steadily.
I don't think technology provides us with everything we need.
zh: 我不觉得科技能提供我们需要的一切。

en: My wife often telephones me when I'm traveling in another country.
zh: 我在国外旅行时，我老婆经常给我打电话。

en: My wife loves apple pie.
zh: 我老婆特别爱吃苹果派。

en: My wife likes apple pie a lot.
There's no place like home.
The whole family was sick in bed.
The whole family was out harvesting the corn.
The family members nursed the patient in turns.
Flags had been hoisted on the eaves of houses.
There are many people trying to buy houses.
We'll use the house as collateral so we can borrow some money.
zh: 我们要用房子做抵押来借点钱。

en: The sky was clear when I left home.
zh: 我出门的时候天挺晴朗的。

en: We've made numerous improvements to our house since we bought it.
zh: 房子买回来后，我们做了很多改动。

en: You must remove your shoes before entering a house.
You have to take off your shoes before entering houses.
One must take off one's shoes before entering houses.
Let's go home.
Each house is near another.
We're not cold in the house.
It's not cold in the house.
It isn't cold in the house.
We aren't cold in the house.
zh: 我们在屋子里不觉得冷。

en: Yesterday, there was a traffic accident in front of the house.
zh: 昨天房子前面出了场车祸。

en: There is a fence around the house.
Our dog buries bones in the garden.
zh: 我们家的狗把骨头埋在花园里。

en: Our dog buries bones in the yard.
zh: 我们家的狗把骨头埋在院子里。

en: Please wait outside the house.
There are always some chores to be done around the house.
zh: 家里总有干不完的杂活。

en: I had barely got in the house when the phone rang.
I had barely got into the house when the phone rang.
zh: 我刚进家门，电话就响了。

en: As soon as I got home, the telephone rang.
I had barely gotten home when the storm broke out.
zh: 我刚到家，暴风雨就来了。

en: When I got home, I noticed that I had lost my wallet.
zh: 到家后我才发现钱包丢了。

en: Please remember to mail the letter on your way home.
zh: 回家路上记得把信寄了。

en: Mary unexpectedly ran into John on her way home.
zh: 玛丽在回家路上意外碰到了约翰。

en: Please let me go home.
I'm going home.
There was a lot of food in the house.
There was lots of food in the house.
I tripped over the mat when I came in the house.
zh: 我进屋的时候被垫子绊了一跤。

en: He's not at home.
I forgot my credit card at home.
I left my credit card at home.
Come over to my place.
I'd rather go out than stay at home.
zh: 我宁愿出去也不想呆在家里。

en: Feeling the house shake, I ran out into the backyard.
zh: 感觉到房子在晃，我赶紧跑到了后院。

en: The house is burning.
You should just wear summer clothes.
If only she'd wear summer clothes.
zh: 她要是穿夏天的衣服就好了。

en: Summer vacation is soon.
We have exams right after summer vacation.
zh: 暑假一结束我们就要考试。

en: Exams are right after summer vacation.
I'm looking forward to your visit during the summer vacation.
zh: 我很期待你暑假过来玩。

en: The summer had gone before I knew it.
zh: 不知不觉夏天就过去了。

en: Summer is over.
Summer has ended.
In the summer, eggs soon go bad.
In the summer, eggs go bad quickly.
In the summer, it's very humid.
I always went to Miami in the summer.
zh: 我以前夏天总去迈阿密。

en: How many times do you go to the beach to swim in the summer?
zh: 你夏天去海边游几次泳？

en: Please conserve water during the summer.
In the summer, we enjoy outdoor sports.
zh: 我们夏天喜欢户外运动。

en: In the summer, they used to play on the beach all day long.
zh: 以前夏天，他们整天都在沙滩上玩。

en: In the summer, people go to the beach.
Mr. Kato was too old to work any longer.
zh: 加藤先生年纪太大了，没法再干活了。

en: Prices depend on the costs and the demand.
zh: 价格取决于成本和需求。

en: Anything is possible.
There were hundreds of people there.
How many nights will you stay?
I wonder if she'll recognize me after all these years.
zh: 我在想，过了这么多年，她还能认出我吗。

en: I wonder if she'll recognize me after so many years.
zh: 我在想，这么多年过去了，她还能认得我吗。

en: I've scolded him many times.
Since he's visited Rome many times, he knows it well.
zh: 因为他去过很多次罗马，所以对那儿很熟。

en: How many people are there in your family?
Some people were late.
When does the shop close?
When does that start?
What time should I pick you up?
Don't do anything halfway.
One has to do one's best in everything.
No matter what it is, we must persevere.
zh: 不管是什么事，都得坚持到底。

en: No matter what happens.
No matter what happens, my determination won't change.
zh: 无论发生什么，我的决心都不会变。

en: What language do they speak in the United States?
What languages are spoken in America?
What language do they speak in the US?
What language is spoken in the USA?
Why didn't you tell me in advance?
Why is Mary going for a picnic with him?
zh: 玛丽为什么要跟他去野餐？

en: Why is Mary going on a picnic with him?
zh: 玛丽为什么要跟他去野餐？

en: How many times do I have to tell you?
How many times will you have to go to the dentist?
How many times do you have to go to the dentist?
What are you cooking?
What are you mad about?
What shall I wear when going there?
What are you waiting for?
What would you like to eat?
What are you thinking?
What're you saying?
What are you saying?
What'll you have to drink?
What'll you drink?
My opinion on what should be done is different from his.
zh: 关于该怎么做，我的想法和他不一样。

en: No matter what you do, you have to do your best.
zh: 不管做什么，你都得尽力。

en: I'm not sure what I should do.
I have to think about what needs to be done.
What're you doing here?
May I help you?
First of all, I'm very worried about my daughter's health.
zh: 首先，我很担心我女儿的健康。

en: What is this the abbreviation for?
Why did he come here?
What illness do I have?
What disease do I have?
Why are you learning English?
For what purpose?
What will you use it for?
What a strange guy!
I cannot say.
We have just gotten to first base.
A Mr. So and So came today.
zh: 今天有个某某先生来了。

en: What did you say?
What's the name of this tune?
How fast!
It's nothing.
What did you say? Could you please say it again?
zh: 你说什么？能请你再说一遍吗？

en: What is this?
What's this?
What is that?
It's out of the question!
No matter what you say, the answer is "no."
zh: 不管你怎么说，反正就是不行。

en: The men will be happy no matter what they get back.
zh: 不管拿回什么，那些男人们都会很高兴的。

en: Have there been any changes?
If you need anything, let me know.
zh: 如果你需要什么，就告诉我。

en: What do you need?
Do you have anything hot to drink?
I would like something to read.
What's cooking in the kitchen?
Do you have something to declare?
Can I get something to eat?
Would you like to eat something?
What do you want to eat?
If something goes wrong, you should take care of it at once.
zh: 要是出什么事了，你得马上处理。

en: As soon as we find out anything, we will contact you.
zh: 我们一有消息就联系你。

en: No matter what happens, I'll keep my promise.
zh: 不管发生什么，我都会遵守诺言。

en: We cannot predict what will happen.
zh: 我们没法预料会发生什么。

en: You never know what'll happen.
zh: 谁也说不准会发生什么。

en: I don't know what'll happen.
Had they known what was about to happen, they would've changed their plans.
zh: 要是他们早知道会发生什么，肯定就改计划了。

en: If they'd known what was about to happen, they would've changed their plans.
zh: 要是他们早知道会发生什么，肯定就改计划了。

en: I really want to know what's going on here.
zh: 我真想知道这儿到底怎么回事。

en: I really want to know what's happening here.
zh: 我真想知道这儿发生了什么。

en: What's happened?
Do you know what's happened?
I can't explain what happened.
zh: 我没法解释发生了什么。

en: It looks like something's going to happen.
Would you like to drink something?
Something bad was about to happen.
Ask me something easier.
Something must be done.
Are you looking for something?
Push the red button if something strange happens.
zh: 要是出什么怪事，就按那个红按钮。

en: I shall not change my mind, no matter what happens.
zh: 不管发生什么，我都不会改变主意的。

en: How can I help you?
Did something happen?
Has something happened?
It's somehow warm.
Please tell me what happened, off the record of course.
zh: 跟我说说到底怎么回事，当然，私下说就行。

en: Suppose for a moment that pigeons had something in their heads which could sense magnetic fields.
zh: 假如鸽子脑袋里有能感应磁场的东西。

en: Many people were late for the concert.
zh: 很多人看音乐会迟到了。

en: It's a lot of fun to listen to music.
Could you tell me how to adjust the volume?
zh: 能告诉我怎么调音量吗？

en: In music, he is a famous critic.
zh: 在音乐方面，他是个很有名的评论家。

en: If it wasn't for music, the world would be a dull place.
zh: 要是没有音乐，这世界就太没意思了。

en: If it weren't for music, the world would be a dull place.
zh: 要是没有音乐，这世界就太没意思了。

en: If it weren't for music, the world would be a boring place.
zh: 要是没有音乐，这世界就太无聊了。

en: Without music, the world would be a boring place.
zh: 没有音乐，世界会很无聊。

en: Could you turn the volume down?
Don't make noise.
Don't make fun of me!
I've heard nothing.
I'm a person.
I'm a human.
I'm disturbing you.
I do not want to clean up dog poop.
Am I wrong?
I'm a good-for-nothing bum.
I'll be the only one in this world.
zh: 这个世界上就剩我一个人了。

en: I think it's OK.
I'm not talking to you. I'm talking to the monkey.
zh: 我没跟你说话，我是在跟猴子说话。

en: You can't pull the wool over my eyes.
Don't tantalize me.
Please listen to what I have to say.
That's my favorite chair.
That's the chair that I really like.
zh: 那把椅子我真的很喜欢。

en: It's my CD, isn't it?
Leave it all to me.
Stay away from me.
My existence is worthless and meaningless.
zh: 我的存在毫无价值，也没什么意义。

en: That's impossible for me.
zh: 这对我来说是不可能的。

en: The roof was torn off due to the strong winds.
That house with a red roof is my uncle's.
zh: 那个红屋顶的房子是我叔叔的。

en: That house with the red roof is Tom's house.
zh: 那个红屋顶的房子是汤姆家。

en: The tiles that fell from the roof broke into pieces.
zh: 房顶掉下来的瓦片摔碎了。

en: The tiles that fell from the roof broke into very small pieces.
zh: 房顶掉下来的瓦片摔得粉碎。

en: It rains a lot in Okinawa.
The king oppressed his people.
Mr. Wang came to Japan to study Japanese.
zh: 王先生来日本学日语了。

en: How's the wife?
Give my regards to your wife.
My nephew was accustomed to staying up late.
Down with corrupt politicians!
Would you like me to help you with washing the dishes?
Can you pass me the salt?
Could you pass the salt?
Could you pass me the salt?
I tried to investigate his opinion indirectly.
zh: 我试着侧面打听了一下他的想法。

en: One can see faraway objects with a telescope.
zh: 用望远镜可以看到远处的物体。

en: We can see things in the distance using a telescope.
zh: 我们可以用望远镜看远处的东西。

en: I saw a hut in the distance.
From a distance, that stone looks like a person's face.
zh: 远远看去，那块石头像个人的脸。

en: Don't say such ill-omened things.
We sprinkle salt to ward off bad luck.
Even monkeys fall from trees.
zh: 猴子也会从树上掉下来。

en: It's easy for monkeys to climb trees.
Smoke poured out of the chimney.
Do you smoke?
Please don't smoke too much.
Don't smoke too much.
You should quit smoking.
Where there's smoke, there's fire.
We're going to watch a play.
It's a ten minute walk to the station.
zh: 到车站走过去要十分钟。

en: It takes 10 minutes to walk to the station.
zh: 步行到车站要花十分钟。

en: I've been to the station.
Could you show me the way to the station?
zh: 麻烦问下，去车站怎么走？

en: How long does it take to the station by taxi?
The station is in the center of the city.
Where is the railway station?
Where is the station?
Where is the train station?
He telephoned her when he arrived at the station.
zh: 他一到车站就给她打了电话。

en: The train had already left by the time I got to the station.
zh: 我到车站的时候，火车已经开了。

en: It took about five minutes to get to my uncle's house from the station.
zh: 从车站到我叔叔家大概要五分钟。

en: Great men are fond of sensual pleasures.
There are people who say that the politeness of Englishmen is essentially a sense of fear.
zh: 有人说英国人的礼貌本质上是出于一种恐惧感。

en: The climate of England isn't as mild as Japan, but in the summer, it's much cooler.
zh: 英国的气候不像日本那么温和，但夏天凉快多了。

en: The English team beat the Brazilian team in the international soccer tournament.
zh: 英国队在国际足球赛里赢了巴西队。

en: Speaking English isn't easy, but it's fun.
zh: 说英语不容易，但挺有意思的。

en: Speaking English isn't easy.
It is not easy to speak English.
She is better at speaking English than any of her classmates.
zh: 她英语说得比班上任何人都好。

en: That boy speaking English is taller than I am.
zh: 那个说英语的男孩比我高。

en: That boy speaking English is taller than me.
zh: 那个说英语的男生比我高。

en: I had to study English.
It's difficult to speak English well.
It's hard to speak English well.
Mastering English is difficult.
It's important for young people to study English.
It's important for today's young people to study English.
zh: 现在的年轻人学英语很重要。

en: I think the best way to learn English is to live in America.
zh: 我觉得学英语最好的办法就是去美国住。

en: Don't quit English.
You shouldn't quit English.
Is English harder than Japanese?
English is spoken around the world.
English is spoken all over the world.
zh: 英语是全球通用的语言。

en: English is a global language.
zh: 英语是一种全球性的语言。

en: English is the language of the world.
English is my native language.
English is my mother tongue.
English is not my mother tongue.
You like English, don't you?
English is not easy, but it is interesting.
zh: 英语虽然不容易，但挺有意思的。

en: English is not hard to learn.
English and German are two related languages.
zh: 英语和德语是两种相关的语言。

en: English is a Germanic language.
English and German share a common ancestor.
zh: 英语和德语有共同的祖先。

en: English is a sister language of German.
zh: 英语和德语是姐妹语言。

en: English is third period.
About how many English words do you know?
zh: 你大概认识多少个英语单词？

en: I don't like the new textbook we're using in the English class.
zh: 我不喜欢英语课上用的那本新课本。

en: In English there are some words borrowed from Japanese.
zh: 英语里有些词是从日语借过来的。

en: Speaking in English is fun.
It's fun to speak in English.
Do I have to answer in English?
It isn't easy to write a love letter in English.
zh: 用英语写情书可不容易。

en: It's not easy writing a love letter in English.
zh: 用英文写情书挺不容易的。

en: It's way too cold to swim.
Swimming is easy for me.
zh: 游泳对我来说挺简单的。

en: Swimming is easy.
It's really easy to learn how to swim.
I would like to go for a swim.
I want to go for a swim.
I'd like to go for a swim.
The boy who is swimming is my younger brother.
zh: 那个在游泳的男孩是我弟弟。

en: I'll never leave you.
I love going to the movies.
I was deeply moved after I saw the movie.
zh: 看完那部电影我挺感动的。

en: Did you enjoy the movie?
Was the movie interesting?
All these movies are boring.
Could you take me to a movie?
zh: 你能带我去看场电影吗？

en: It's like a scene from a movie, isn't it?
zh: 这就像电影里的场景，不是吗？

en: This seems like something out of a movie, doesn't it?
zh: 这跟电影里演的一样，不是吗？

en: Let's go to a movie.
Are you going to a movie?
Which would you rather do, go to a movie or stay at home?
zh: 你想去看电影还是待在家里？

en: I'd rather stay at home than go to the movies.
zh: 我宁愿待在家里也不想去看电影。

en: We are going to the cinema.
I'm going to the cinema.
I plan to go to the movies.
I'm going to the movies.
The movie is popular with young people.
zh: 这部电影在年轻人里很受欢迎。

en: A cloud is a mass of vapor.
If clouds did not exist, then we would have no enjoyment of the sun.
zh: 要是没云的话，我们就没法好好欣赏阳光了。

en: The clouds are getting darker and darker and it's beginning to look like it might rain.
zh: 云越来越黑了，看着要下雨了。

en: Fortune favors the bold.
zh: 机会总是垂青勇敢的人。

en: You should exercise.
You should get some exercise.
May I see your driver's license?
Fasten your seat belt while driving.
The driver is deeply attached to his old car.
zh: 司机对他那辆旧车很有感情。

en: You can't be too careful when you drive.
zh: 开车的时候怎么小心都不为过。

en: Talk of the devil and he's sure to appear.
The rumor isn't true as far as I know.
zh: 就我所知，那个传闻不是真的。

en: The rumor turned out to be true.
The rumor is that they're going to Australia.
zh: 传闻说他们要去澳大利亚。

en: Lying is wrong.
It's wrong to lie.
If you tell too many lies, people won't ever believe you.
zh: 谎话要是说多了，大家就再也不会相信你了。

en: You're lying, aren't you?
Everyone hates you because you are lying all the time. You get what you deserve.
zh: 大家都讨厌你，因为你老撒谎，你这是活该。

en: If it rains, call me.
zh: 要是下雨了，给我打电话。

en: Adversity strengthens the foundations.
It's stopped raining.
It rained for a week.
I couldn't go out because of the rain.
I couldn't come because of the rain.
I wasn't able to come because of the rain.
Because of the rain, the boys couldn't play baseball on the playground.
zh: 因为下雨，男孩子们没法在操场上打棒球。

en: You don't want to get wet and catch a cold, so take this umbrella with you.
zh: 别淋湿感冒了，带上这把伞。

en: You should take an umbrella in case it rains.
You'd better take an umbrella with you in case it rains.
zh: 你最好带把伞，以防下雨。

en: It looks like rain. We should close the windows.
zh: 看着要下雨了，咱们把窗户关了吧。

en: I discouraged him from going swimming since it looked like it was going to rain.
zh: 看着要下雨，我劝他别去游泳。

en: I discouraged him from going swimming because it looked like it was going to rain.
zh: 因为看着要下雨，我没让他去游泳。

en: It looks like rain. You'd better take an umbrella with you.
zh: 看着要下雨，你最好带把伞。

en: Whether rains or not, the game is going to be held.
zh: 不管下不下雨，比赛都照常举行。

en: Since it was raining, I stayed home.
zh: 因为下雨，我待在家里了。

en: It was raining, so I stayed home.
zh: 下雨了，所以我待在家里。

en: As soon as the rain stopped, the tennis match continued.
zh: 雨一停，网球赛就继续了。

en: As soon as it stopped raining a beautiful rainbow appeared.
zh: 雨一停，就出了一道美丽的彩虹。

en: Let's wait until it stops raining.
Since it's raining, I'd better go home.
zh: 既然在下雨，我还是回家吧。

en: The roof leaks every time it rains.
He said that it would probably rain.
They say it will rain.
It might rain.
It keeps raining.
Since it began raining, I ran into the house.
zh: 雨一下起来，我就跑进屋了。

en: I ran into the house because it started to rain.
zh: 因为开始下雨了，我就跑进了屋里。

en: It has started raining.
It looks like it's going to rain.
If it weren't for the rain, we would have had a pleasant journey.
zh: 要不是下雨，我们的旅行本来会很开心的。

en: We would've enjoyed our trip if it wasn't for the rain.
zh: 要不是因为下雨，我们这趟本来会玩得很好。

en: We would've enjoyed our trip if it hadn't been for the rain.
zh: 要不是因为下雨，我们这次旅行本来会很愉快。

en: Since it's raining, it would be better if you stayed at home.
zh: 既然在下雨，你最好还是待在家里。

en: It's raining, so you should stay at home.
zh: 下雨了，你就在家待着吧。

en: We stayed at home because it was raining.
zh: 因为下雨，我们就待在家里了。

en: We had to postpone the gathering because of rain.
zh: 因为下雨，我们不得不推迟聚会。

en: Even though it was raining, they went on their outing.
zh: 尽管下着雨，他们还是去郊游了。

en: It was raining. However, they still went on their school trip.
zh: 虽然下雨了，但他们还是按计划去修学旅行了。

en: Even though it was raining, they went on their field trip.

I often have nightmares.
I often have bad dreams.
For better or worse, there is nothing to do but to leave the matter in his hands.
zh: 不管怎么样，现在只能把这件事交给他处理了。

en: For better or worse, all we can do is leave the matter in his hands.
zh: 无论好坏，我们能做的只有把这事儿托付给他。

en: For better or worse, we can't do anything but leave this matter up to him.
zh: 不管结局如何，我们也只能让他去管这事了。

en: Europeans like to drink wine.
I travelled around Europe.
I traveled around Europe.
Many of Europe's metropolises are plagued by the donut phenomenon.
zh: 欧洲许多大都市都深受“城市空心化”现象的困扰。

en: I finally have time to reply to the mail that I have received these past three weeks.
zh: 我终于有时间回过去三周收到的邮件了。

en: Finally I have time to reply to the mail I received these three weeks.
zh: 总算有时间回复这三周收到的信了。

en: I went to the theater early to get a good seat.
zh: 我早点去剧院是为了占个好位子。

en: I went to the theater early so I could get a good seat.
zh: 我特意去早点，好在剧院坐个好位置。

en: We went to the theater early so we could get good seats.
zh: 我们去剧院去得早，为了能坐上好位子。

en: We went to the theater early to get good seats.
zh: 我们早早到了剧院去占好座儿。

en: Good question!
That's a good question.
It's a good question.
Have a good trip!
Have a nice trip.
Have a good trip.
Can you recommend a good camera, please?
zh: 麻烦给我推荐一款好相机。

en: The baby in the cradle is very cute.
Yumi has a lot of money now.
In a section that is separated from mainstream of Jews and orthodox school, apocalyptic has achieved success in typical movements.
zh: 在脱离犹太主流和正统派的教派中，天启论在一些典型运动中获得了成功。

en: Isaac was a leader of the Jewish people.
zh: 以撒曾是犹太人的领袖。

en: Did you feel the earthquake last night?
zh: 昨晚地震你感觉到了吗？

en: Last night's game was exciting.
The Yankees are running away with the pennant race.
zh: 扬基队在冠军争夺战中遥遥领先。

en: There's still plenty that needs to be done.
There's still much to do.
There's still a lot to be done.
There are still many things left to do.
A lot still remains to be done.
There are still a lot of things that have to be done.
There are still a lot of things to do.
There's still a lot to do.
There's a lot left to be done.
There's still so much to be done.
Please show me how to do it.
Please show me how to do that.
zh: 请示范一下那个怎么弄。

en: You've overdone it.
I don't have the time to do everything I want to do.
zh: 我没时间把我所有想做的事都做了。

en: I feel depressed because there were a lot of things I had to do.
zh: 事情太多了，搞得我很郁闷。

en: I told you to stop, didn't I?
I finally got a driver's license.
I finally graduated from junior high school.
My turn finally came.
The pain finally went away.
Finally, it's Friday.
We're going home.
The semester exams are finally over.
I finally found out what was wrong with my TV.
zh: 我终于弄清楚我的电视出什么毛病了。

en: I think it's better not to try it.
Eventually, he forgot about the incident.
zh: 最后他把那件事给忘了。

en: By and by, the bitter north wind will begin to blow.
zh: 慢慢地，刺骨的北风就要刮起来了。

en: I hope it'll clear up soon.
Before long, it'll be cold again.
zh: 没过多久，天又要变冷了。

en: Hi, how are you?
Hi. How are you?
Don't look a gift horse in the mouth.
zh: 别人送的东西就别挑三拣四了。

en: I don't need a loan anymore.
I no longer need a loan.
If you don't study harder, you'll fail for sure.
zh: 你要是再不努力学习，肯定会挂科的。

en: If you don't study harder, you'll definitely fail.
zh: 你不更努力点儿，绝对会不及格的。

en: You should have spoken more politely.
zh: 你说话本该更客气点儿。

en: You should've spoken more politely.
zh: 你说话本该再客气点的。

en: Please speak in a louder voice.
Please speak more loudly.
A little louder, please.
Make it larger.
Please say it more loudly.
I'm sorry that I didn't reply to you sooner.
I'm sorry that I didn't reply sooner.
I'm sorry I didn't reply sooner.
You should have warned him sooner.
I should've left earlier.
We should have departed earlier.
We should have left earlier.
We should've left earlier.
I'm sorry that I didn't email you sooner.
zh: 不好意思没能早点给你发邮件。

en: I'm sorry I didn't email you sooner.
zh: 抱歉没早点给你发邮件。

en: Make it smaller.
Could you turn it down?
Please turn down the volume.
If I'd had more time, I would've written to you.
zh: 如果时间再多点，我就给你写信了。

en: I could've done better if I'd had more time.
zh: 要是时间充裕，我能做得更好。

en: I would've written a longer letter if I'd had more time.
zh: 要是时间再多点，我就把信写得更长了。

en: A more experienced lawyer would've dealt with the case in a different way.
zh: 经验更丰富的律师处理这个案子的方式会不一样。

en: If you'd prefer a room closer to the Convention Center, please contact us.
zh: 如果您想住得离会展中心近点，请联系我们。

en: If you'd prefer a room closer to the Convention Center, please let us know.
zh: 如果您想找离会展中心更近的房间，请告知我们。

en: If you'd studied harder, you would've passed the examination.
zh: 你要是再用功点，考试就过了。

en: Do you have any cheaper rooms?
Could you speak more slowly?
Please speak more slowly.
Speak slower, please.
Please speak slower.
You should begin with easier questions.
zh: 你应该先从简单点的问题开始。

en: I should've come earlier.
Of course, he is right.
Of course I'll wait.
Of course I'll go.
Of course.
Of course!
Of course she passed the test.
Come if you can.
If you want to come with us, come with us.
zh: 想跟我们一起的话就一起来吧。

en: If it snows a lot tomorrow, let's make a snowman.
zh: 要是明天雪下得大，咱们就去堆雪人。

en: If it rains tomorrow, the excursion will be canceled.
zh: 如果明天下雨，郊游就取消。

en: What should we do if he happens to come late?
What should we do if he comes late?
If it rains, he won't come.
If by any chance it should rain, he won't come.
If for some reason she came to Japan, Jane would be very happy.
zh: 要是简因为什么原因去了日本，她会很高兴的。

en: If I were you, I'd ignore it.
If I were you, I would ignore it.
zh: 如果我是你，我就不理这事。

en: If I were you, I'd follow his advice.
zh: 要是我，我就听他的建议。

en: If I were you, I wouldn't do that kind of thing.
zh: 要是我，我才不会做那种事。

en: If my mother had still been alive, she would have helped me at that time.
zh: 如果我妈还活着，她那时候肯定会帮我的。

en: If I weren't sick, I'd join you.
zh: 要不是我病了，我就跟你们一起去了。

en: If you had a million dollars, what would you do?
zh: 如果你有一百万美元，你会干什么？

en: Without his help, I might fail.
zh: 要是没有他的帮忙，我可能会失败。

en: If I had known his address, I would have written him a letter.
zh: 如果我知道他的地址，我就给他写信了。

en: If it had not been for his timely hit, our team would have lost the game.
zh: 要不是他那一击很及时，我们队就输了。

en: If he asks us for help, we'll help him.
zh: 如果他找我们帮忙，我们就帮他。

en: If he had gotten her advice, he would have succeeded.
zh: 要是他听了她的建议，他就成功了。

en: If he had received her advice, he would have succeeded.
zh: 要是他得到了她的建议，他就成功了。

en: If he's late, it's OK to start the meeting without him.
zh: 要是他迟到了，不带他也行，咱们直接开会。

en: I'll certainly be sad if he dies.
zh: 要是他去世了，我肯定会很难过。

en: If he'd known the truth, he'd have told me.
zh: 要是他知道真相，肯定会告诉我的。

en: If I'd had enough money, I would've bought the book.
zh: 要是我钱够的话，我就买那本书了。

en: If it's convenient, please come here tonight.
zh: 如果方便的话，你今晚过来一下。

en: If there were no telephones, it would be inconvenient.
zh: 如果没有电话，那可太不方便了。

en: If you intend to win, you should do your best.
zh: 如果你想赢，就得尽全力。

en: If you hadn't had advice, you'd have failed.
zh: 要是没人给你建议，你早就失败了。

en: Without advice, you would have failed.
zh: 要是没有建议的话，你肯定会失败的。

en: What would you do if you failed?
zh: 要是你失败了，你会怎么办？

en: If you arrive home before me, please feel free to have a few drinks and relax.
zh: 要是你比我先到家，就随便喝点东西放松一下。

en: If you had followed my advice, you wouldn't be in such a fix now.
zh: 要是你当初听了我的建议，现在也不至于这么麻烦。

en: But for my advice you would have failed.
zh: 要不是因为我的建议，你早就失败了。

en: If you hadn't had my advice, you would have failed.
zh: 要是没有我的建议，你早就失败了。

en: If you hadn't had my advice, you would've failed.
zh: 要是没有我的建议，你那时肯定就失败了。

en: If I'd had enough money, I could've bought it.
zh: 要是我钱够的话，我就能买下它了。

en: If I were a bird, I would fly to you.
zh: 要是我是一只鸟，我就飞到你身边了。

en: If I'm late, don't wait for me.
zh: 要是我迟到了，就别等我了。

en: If I were a boy, I could join the baseball team.
zh: 要是我个男孩子，我就能加入棒球队了。

en: If I'd been with you, I could've helped you.
zh: 要是我当时跟你在一起，我就能帮你了。

en: If I were you, I'd go home right away.
Without your help, he would have failed.
zh: 要是没有你的帮助，他肯定失败了。

en: If you are a member of a primitive community and wish to produce food, for example, there are two things you must do.
zh: 比如你是一个原始部落的成员并想要生产食物，有两件事是你必须做的。

en: If you'd run all the way, you'd have arrived there in time.
zh: 要是你一路跑过去，就能准时到了。

en: If you'd run all the way, you would've gotten there in time.
zh: 要是你一路跑过去，那时候就赶到了。

en: If you'd parked your car here, you would've been fined.
zh: 要是你把车停这儿，会被罚款的。

en: If you'd parked your car here, you'd have been fined.
zh: 要是你把车停这儿，你会被罚款的。

en: They would've gotten a better exchange rate if they'd gone to a bank.
zh: 要是他们去银行的话，汇率会更好一点。

en: In case of fire, I would grab my flute and escape.
zh: 万一起火了，我会拿着我的笛子逃跑。

en: If it rains, bring the washing in.
zh: 要是下雨了，就把洗好的衣服收进来。

en: What should we do if it rains?
zh: 要是下雨了我们该怎么办？

en: If he had worked harder, he could have succeeded.
zh: 要是他再努力点，可能就成功了。

en: If I lose your love, I lose everything.
zh: 如果我失去了你的爱，我就失去了一切。

en: Hello. May I speak to Mr. Johnson, please?
zh: 你好，请问约翰逊先生在吗？

en: If Cleopatra's nose had been shorter, the history of the world would be different.
zh: 如果克利奥帕特拉的鼻子再短一点，世界历史可能就大不一样了。

en: With a little more patience, you would've succeeded.
zh: 只要再多一点耐心，你那时候就成功了。

en: If it were true, what would you do?
zh: 如果那是真的，你会怎么办？

en: If that were true, what would you do?
zh: 如果那是真的，你会怎么做？

en: If not for the ozone layer, we would be in imminent danger.
zh: 要不是有臭氧层，我们现在就处于危险之中了。

en: Without water, the soldiers would've died.
zh: 如果没有水，那些士兵早就没命了。

en: Without your help, I couldn't have done it.
zh: 要是没有你的帮助，我肯定做不到。

en: Had it not been for your help, I couldn't have done it.
zh: 要不是因为你的帮忙，我肯定完成不了。

en: I couldn't have done it without your help.
zh: 没你帮忙的话，我可做不到。

en: If I were you, I would apply for the job.
zh: 如果我是你，我就去申请那份工作。

en: If you go fishing tomorrow, I'll go, too.
zh: 要是你明天去钓鱼，我也去。

en: If you hadn't helped me, I would've failed.
zh: 如果你当时没帮我，我肯定就失败了。

en: Have you had dinner yet?
I'm full.
My stomach's full.
Have you gotten over your cold yet?
Are you over your cold yet?
I can't put up with his insults any longer.
zh: 我再也受不了他的侮辱了。

en: Have you called him yet?
I won't talk to him anymore.
She got to the point of not thinking she would want to live in this town again.
zh: 她已经到了再也不想住在这个镇上的地步了。

en: You'd better not go there again.
Have you already had lunch?
Have you had lunch?
It's late, so turn off the TV.
I definitely won't do that again.
zh: 我绝对不会再那么做了。

en: I've been reading this for a few hours.
zh: 这东西我看了好几个小时了。

en: Are you finished reading the newspaper?
Are you finished reading the paper?
It's your bedtime.
Now that we've finished eating, let's go.
I couldn't eat another bite.
I want to sleep a little longer.
I'd like to sleep a little longer.
With a little more patience, you could've succeeded.
zh: 要是再多点耐心，你本来就能成功了。

en: I should've paid a little more attention.
zh: 我原本应该多留心一点的。

en: Make it a little louder.
Make it a little bigger.
Make it a little larger.
Turn it up.
Turn up the volume.
Please turn up the sound.
Please wait a little while longer.
Give me a minute.
If you had come a little earlier, you could have met her.
zh: 要是你早点儿来，就能见到她了。

en: If they'd left a little earlier, they would've avoided the traffic jam.
zh: 要是他们早点儿出发，就不会遇到堵车了。

en: If I'd left a little earlier, I would've caught the last train.
zh: 我要是早点儿走，就能赶上末班车了。

en: If you'd left a little earlier, you would've avoided the heavy traffic.
zh: 要是你早走一点儿，就能避开大堵车了。

en: Do you have one that is a little smaller?
zh: 有没有稍微小一点儿的？

en: If you'd been a little more patient, you could've succeeded.
zh: 要是你再耐心点儿，你本来可以成功的。

en: If you'd been a little more patient, you would've succeeded.
zh: 要是你再耐心点儿，你早就成功了。

en: Could you please speak a little slower?
Can you speak a little slower?
Could I drink some more tea?
Would it be OK if I drank a little more tea?
Spring has come.
Spring is here.
Spring is coming.
Have you already finished?
He's not young anymore.
She's no spring chicken.
We don't have time.
Please don't write to me again.
It's time the kids went to bed.
Quit behaving like a kid.
zh: 别再像个小孩子一样了。

en: Stop acting like a child.
It's about time you went to the barber's.
I think we'd better wait for another thirty minutes.
zh: 我看我们最好再等三十分钟。

en: I think we'd better wait another thirty minutes.
zh: 我觉得咱们最好再等半小时。

en: I must go now.
I must be leaving now.
It's time for you to get up.
I don't wear glasses anymore.
I think we're too late.
zh: 我觉得我们已经太晚了。

en: It's all over for us.
You should go home now.
Go home now.
How about another beer?
Would you like to have another cup of tea?
Stick to it.
I'd like to climb Mt. Fuji once again.
If there is ever another war, we will all die.
zh: 如果再发生战争，我们都会死。

en: If there's another war, we'll all die.
zh: 如果再打仗，我们都会没命。

en: I wish that I were young again.
zh: 我真希望我能再年轻一次。

en: Could you please repeat it once again?
zh: 能麻烦你再重复一遍吗？

en: Would you mind saying that once more?
If he makes one more mistake, he'll be fired.
zh: 如果他再犯一次错，就会被开除。

en: Please do that again.
If he were given another chance, he'd do his best.
zh: 如果再给他一次机会，他会尽全力的。

en: Given another chance, he'd do his best.
zh: 再给一次机会的话，他会拼尽全力的。

en: If you gave him another chance, he'd do his best.
zh: 要是你再给他一次机会，他会表现得很好。

en: Try doing it once more.
I want to go there again.
I want to go there once again.
Would you please repeat what you said? I didn't quite catch your name.
zh: 请再说一遍好吗？我没听清你的名字。

en: I beg your pardon. I didn't quite catch your name.
zh: 抱歉，我没听清你的名字。

en: Please say it once more.
Could you please repeat what you just said?
zh: 能麻烦你重复一下刚才的话吗？

en: How's that again?
Let's give it one more try.
Let's try it again.
Let's try it once more.
Once again.
One more time.
I think I'll have one more ice cream cone.
